alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coos and northeastern Grafton Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Derby Center to near Brighton to near Littleton to near Piermont. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Lincoln, Haverhill, Franconia, Errol, Pittsburg, Dixville, Woodstock, Stratford, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Piermont, Carroll, Gorham, Lisbon and Jefferson. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 94 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
